definition: lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
variant of 紙|纸[zhi3]
intoxicated
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
variant of 奢靡[she1 mi2]
extravagant
lit. to celebrate peace with songs and dance (idiom)/fig. to make a show of happiness and prosperity
lit. stout horses and light furs/fig. to live in luxury
ostentatious/pretentious/showy
extravagant in the extreme (idiom)
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
money squandering establishment (e.g. gambling den, brothel etc)
to go to the brothel on horseback (idiom); to visit prostitutes
lakes of wine and forests of meat (idiom); debauchery/sumptuous entertainment
magnificent carriage and precious horses (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury
precious horses and magnificent carriage (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury
flourishing/bustling
